result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C. Helvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin C. Helvey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin C. Helvey was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Justin C. Helvey was found guilty of Possess Methamphetamine Precursors [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.
  • Justin C. Helvey was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Judge re eligibility for prison program - denied
Setencing After Revocation - 10/02/2018
revoked

10:15 a.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Justin C. Helvey in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence - All counts CC
Count 1- 
Jail -9 months

Count 2 -
Wisconsin State Prison - 6 years
Initial Confinement - 3 years
Extended Supervision - 3 years

Count 5 - 
Wisconsin State Prison - 3 - 1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 18 months
Extended Supervision - 2 years

Credit for time served - 776 days

Appeal rights given.
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
Defendant is eligible but is not suitable for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Adj. 10:40 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 2, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
8:35 am Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Justin C. Helvey in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF284 and 15cf289. Side Bar. In 15CF284, Schiek/Shawl/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence - each count 
WHS/POP - 4 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Conditional Jail - 138 days
Jail credit - 100 days
Comply with any orders from Children's Court, either in State of Wisconsin or State of Illinois, related to minor children.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. Payment plan application given.   

In 15cf289 - Defendant waives extradition rights. Defendant signs waiver in presence of Court. Shawl presents written waiver. Waiver free and voluntary. Court approves Waiver. Extradition by Illinois within statutory time limits after conditional jail time.

Any other citations, if any, are dismissed. 
Adj. 9:15 a.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued

Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Justin C. Helvey in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 15cf284 and 16cf3
State moves to dismiss counts 3 and 4 in 15cf284 and 16cf3 in its entirety- Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to counts 1,2 and 5 -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Both parties request adj for sentencing-for defendant to brief/provide information to agency.  
Bail is revoked and will be held for sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Amended
State's Reply to Discovery continued
State's Reply to Discovery continued
State's Reply to Discovery continued

2:06 p.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf284, 15cf289 and 16cf03. Shawl statement that no agreement has been reached. Schiek/Shawl statements for final pre-trial date. Attorney Shawl requests bail jumping case - 16cf03 - be tried with 15cf284. Pre trial date of March 1, 2016 rescheduled. Adj. 2:12 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

10:42 a.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf03, 15cf284 and 15cf289.   Shawl statement that waiving preliminary hearing and withdrawing motion to dismiss. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty plea. Bail continued. Adj. 10:45 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

9:04 a.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court, in custody, with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicole Johnson in court with attorney Robert Hanson. Calling 15cf284, 15cf289, 16cf03, 16cf01 15tr2893. In 16cf03, Shawl motion to dismiss - State files Amended Complaint; Shawl in receipt of amended complaint but has not had opportunity to review - requests that motion to dismiss be held over. Shawl requests that preliminary hearing be adjourned also. State is prepared to go forward today with preliminary hearing. State takes no position on adjournment. Court will proceed with Adjourned initial appearance today and schedule for prelimin on amended complaint. Shawl - in receipt of Amended Complaint - waives further reading - sets preliminary hearing. Motion for modification of bond - Michlig statement - State does not object to motion - Court statement on motion - Court amends any pending bonds to provide contact by telephone or by face-to-face visitation - in normal visitation rooms at jail while Helvey is in custody. In event children's court proceedings are conducted - not a violation of bond to be in courtroom for those proceedings. On Court's motion - If there are other bonds pending that preclude contact, bond is also amended in those cases. Shawl - may pictures be exchanged - Court - subject to understanding that any written materials will be subject to inspection by Sheriff - such contact is permitted. Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:30 am. Adj. 9:17 a.m.
for Modification of Bond  - includes cover letter
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:21 p.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Justin C. Helvey in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf284, 15tr2893, 15cf289 and 16cf03. In 15cf284, Shawl statement - prepared to waive preliminary hearing -  Court explains purpose of preliminary hearing to defendant - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Shawl expects to be appointed in 16cf03. Shawl states complaint in 16cf03 is insufficient - moves to dismiss complaint but suggests adjournment to allow State to file amended complaint. Court schedules preliminary hearing in 16cf03 with leave to file motions - Shawl moves to modify bond - requests contact with Nichole Johnson be allowed - Bednar statement to motion to modify bond - Court denies motion but would reconsider if co-defendants bring motion at same time. In 15cf284, State files Information - Shawl in receipt of Information - waives further reading - enters not guilty pleas. Shawl requests speedy trial. In 16cf03 - defendant waives times for prelimin hearing - Preliminary hearing scheduled for 9:00 a.m. Friday, January 22, 2016. All cases to be scheduled January 22, 2016 for status. Bail continued. Adj. 3:45 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
- includes cover letter

3:00 p.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf284, 15tr2893 and 15cf289. In 15cf284 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Shawl requests clarification on bond regarding N. Johnson - 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:06 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

1:41 p.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court, in custody, via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement that defendant is eligible for PD - PD's office contacted Court and notified that they need to appoint counsel. When attorney is appointed, Attorney is free to schedule sooner court date. In Fugitive Complaint file, Schiek in receipt of Waiver of Extradition - Schiek requests defendant's in person appearance at next hearing in this matter. Adj. 1:44 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

NO contact WHATSOEVER with Chantil Rahlf, Nichole Johnson or Joel Hughes.  May have telephonic or electronic contact with Nichole Johnson ONLY For purposes of mutual parental responsibilities and court appearances concerning minor children.

1:36 p.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek files Fugitive Complaint - complaint to be provided to Defendant - Will be considered at later time -  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Adj. 10:21 a.m.

10:42 a.m. Defendant Justin C. Helvey in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf03, 15cf284 and 15cf289.   Shawl statement that waiving preliminary hearing and withdrawing motion to dismiss. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty plea. Bail continued. Adj. 10:45 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
